alternatives.transcript: we continue our look at smoking now with Bill aylward assistant to the president of the tobacco Institute and welcome to the program sir let's begin with the issue of new one I guess it is slipstream smoking so we'll study showing that non-smokers now facing severe health risk by being passed around smokers one study just recently published I'm sure you're aware of showing non-smoking women with smoking husbands were almost three times as likely to have cancer as non-smoking women married to non-smoking now what do you make of

things like that what do I make of them yeah and well there has been a considerable amount of a number of statements by anti-smoking force is that in fact there has been increasing evidence on the sidestream smoke issue but this doesn't really stand up in fact the United States Department of Health and Human Services conducted a seminar that during this last year and they're in May of last year the results were published in December and it's just one line actually in the summer

conclusions that might interest you it says in review of the data from the studies which have been carried out or are in progress and that includes the study you mentioned and others which address the effect of passive smoking on the respiratory system suggest that the effect varies from negligible to quite small there was an additional study that was held over in Europe within the last very few months in which it was reported in the European Journal of respiratory diseases but it was conducted by the University of Geneva and what it said in effect was the same thing there

is apparently no indication at this point at least that there is more than a very very minor reaction from secondhand smoke so I know you can take one study or you can take the Health and Human Services study it's up to you does the tobacco industry fund its own studies on this issue and if so what do they show if not why don't you do those studies well we do those studies in fact we are the largest single contributor to Independent research we've spent about 120 million dollars so far this money is distributed

tributed through the council for tobacco research which is headed by prominent Physicians totally autonomous organization which we have no control over and the money is spent primarily in the areas of Research Laboratories and universities across the country those studies of course are available to everyone we publish them every year that they basically that the studies indicate the same kind of trend the Surgeon General himself in the 1982 report said there was insufficient evidence at this time to indicate that

is a relationship between s second hand or sidestream smoke and a variety of these diseases and this seems to be a general direction and as far as the researchers artists real word some people say you may have the toughest job around anywhere depending the tobacco industry in light of all the studies linking smoking to cancer and other serious health problems does the tobacco industry still deny there's any linked to tobacco smoking and various diseases such as lung cancer no I don't think they ever did

did what we're saying is there is epidemiological or statistical evidence that seems to indicate there's a relationship between smoking and a variety of diseases however the large virtually all of the studies that have been conducted have only used one risk factor that is smoking itself and didn't consider other risk factors such as genetics or what kind of work do you do or what you eat or where you live and we feel that those increments are important in terms of an overall study we still

have not established no one has established the biologic mechanism that little key that turns the cell that causes it to become cancerous we do know that for example in countries like Yugoslavia and the Philippines and Japan where there is a very high smoking rate far higher than the United States whereas a considerably lower rate of squamous cell carcinoma of the lung cancer or heart disease and so we feel that that really puts us in the direction where more research is

needed well you must be concerned about people who are increasingly quitting smoking obviously not everybody is quitting smoking however there is there are more and more movements toward Banning cigarettes in public places in airplanes and so forth you must be really worried about that well I think the word of course is worried no I'm not particularly worried about that the single most the single biggest impact on cigarette sales and

years has been one of the federal government last year increased the tax on cigarettes from 8 to 16 cents a pack a tremendous increase there is a sunset provision that that will be reduced back again in a couple of years but that really did affect cigarette sales as far as the sidestream smoke or or as you mentioned as I say the studies don't seem to indicate the sir problem there and the CIB recently turned down a move to restrict smoking completely on short-term flights now I don't

I think the second hand smoke issue is as big as some people do and apparently neither does dr. Larry garfinkel if the American Cancer Society because he says he believes it's a political matter more than it is a physiological one so people we have talk to whoever I can't reveal who they are this times are indicating that new study will be up very shortly indicating another link to this whole issue of slipstream smoking and if that were true for to proves out to be fairly accurate that would be a severe problem for a cigarette manufacturers and could because

then you're affecting people who don't smoke and you can have local laws all over the country if not even Federal legislation well I agree with you that in fact if that kind of a study definitively that included other elements other risk factors the kind of heat you have in your home and so on but the fact is that the government has examined the study ongoing study that you referred to and still issued this report in December of 1983 saying they consider the effect of the negligible to quite

small all of the studies that are ongoing were available to the government at the time plus those that have already been completed I don't think the second hand smoke issue is is a as big an issue as it is in the minds of some people who are let's put it this way emotionally involved in the issue as dr. Michael halberstam said the tears in their eyes of more of Rage than they are of physiological Effect one final question got asked a do you smoke well guess I don't have a garage yes okay this one check on that
